page.title: 05The Mayor
page.content: 1985 finds Mr. Clifford Reeks in the second year of acting as Lydney's mayor. He wears the silver-gilt chain of office, presented by local benefactor John Watts in 1967, with great pride and enjoys his many and varied duties. Born in the neighbouring village of Aylburton, he has spent almost all of his life in the area. He first became a councillor in 1973. Unlike some big city counterparts he has to combine the office with a full time job which often presents difficulties. As well as council committees his attendance is often sought at frequent local events, civic occasions and local hospital visits. He particularly enjoys attending youth centred events and confesses to being sometimes lost for words when asked to speak.
